sentences.sentence: Israel has moved troops, tanks and other military hardware to the border with the Gaza Strip as it prepares for a possible ground invasion of the Palestinian territory.

sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to crush the Hamas military group after its ferocious attack last weekend. We will reach a point where whoever leads Gaza will be severely separated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And whoever stays there will understand that such a thing is not done to the State of Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The intense military response to the surprise Hamas attack has left Palestinians isolated in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Israel has cut power and water supplies to the territory, home to over two million people. Palestinian officials say at least 1,500 people have been killed, a third of them children, in Israeli attacks. In his first public comments, the president of the Palestinian Authority called Thursday for an immediate end to aggression against Palestinians. During a meeting in Amman with King Abdul II of Jordan, Mahmoud Abbas rejected practices that consist of killing or abusing civilians in either camp. He also called for the release of civilian prisoners and detainees.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Tension between communities is running higher and higher in the divided city of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Jerusalem. This Thursday night Two Palestinian men were killed after shooting incidents with the police in front of a police station just outside the old city of Jerusalem and six police officers were injured, one of them in critical condition. And it's the second such incident this week. On Tuesday, two other Palestinian men were killed by the police after throwing rocks and fireworks at them. So there is a lot of anxiety amongst the population in Jerusalem. And actually, the streets are unusually quiet. You can hardly see any cars driving around. And people are very much staying at home. And now there is a lot of fear as what could happen over the weekend. for the Muslims on Friday and Shabbat for the Jews on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And it will be the first religious celebrations since the first attacks occurred.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So nobody knows what might happen, but in any case, security is at a maximum level in the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I'm Valérie Gouriat in Jerusalem for Euronews.

sentences.sentence: Now it's the two million inhabitants of the Strip who will pay the price, with a total siege ordered by Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: A surprise attendance at the summit by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky proved fruitful with the US announcing 200 million dollars of extra military aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In addition, over 100 million euros was pledged by the Ukraine Contact Group and Germany has considerably stepped up its support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The IOC's executive board has suspended the Russian Olympic Committee with immediate effect until further notice. This decision follows the ROC's recognition of regional sports organizations in four Ukrainian territories that Russia has claimed to have annexed since the full-scale invasion in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Speaking after the opening day of an executive board meeting in Mumbai, IOC spokesman Mark Adams made the announcement whilst highlighting the consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian Olympic Committee is no longer entitled to operate as a national Olympic committee, as defined in the Olympic Charter, and cannot receive any funding from the Olympic movement. Adams added that the suspension hadn't yet affected the possibility of neutral Russian athletes competing at next year's Paris Olympics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Currently IOC sanctions mean no international sporting events can be organized in either Russia or Belarus, whilst the flags and national anthems of both countries must not be used.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sunday's election in Poland could be crucial for the future of the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The country's two main parties, the conservative nationalist right-wing Law and Justice Party, currently in power, and the liberal pro-European right-wing civil platform, are both unlikely to be able to form a government alone. e la platforma civile libero-pro-europea non è probabilmente in grado di formare un governo solo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I membri del Parlamento europeo hanno realizzato l'importanza del voto, ma sperano di vari risultati. per la sua fortissima opposizione alle politiche espansioniste di Putin in Ucraina e quindi una conferma della maggioranza di governo andrebbe in continuità con questa scelta e sarebbe certamente un fattore di stabilità per la postura geopolitica dell'Unione Europea nel suo complesso. that the current opposition has clearly taken a constructive stance when it comes to engaging on the European level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: So when we see the challenges that are ahead of us, be it around the question how are we going to shape the green transformation, migration politics, also other issues, they have maybe taken conservative standpoints, but they are constructive in engaging on the European level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The current Polish government has been taking a hostile attitude towards the EU for many years now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The main clash between Warsaw and Brussels concerns respect for the rule of law and independence of the judiciary from political influence. On Sunday, Brussels will keep an eye not only on the elections, but also on the Polish government's referendum, which contains four questions, one of which will ask Poles if they support the admission of what the government calls illegal immigrants from the Middle East and Africa, in line with the E.U.'s mandatory relocation rules designed to ease the burden on the bloc's border countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Republican Steve Scalise has pulled out of the race for U.S. House Speaker after meeting fierce resistance from hardliners within his party. The Louisiana congressman narrowly beat far-right candidate Jim Jordan to the party's nomination, but realized on Thursday he wouldn't be able to secure the 217 votes necessary to get elected. Political pressure is mounting on Republicans as the House enters its second week without a speaker, leaving it unable to function during a time of turmoil in the U. the US and overseas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's a long way from a cow chopped in half and preserved in a tank of formaldehyde, but these paintings are by Damien Hirst. He may have been the infante reable of the British art scene, but now he seems to have calmed down. The Secret Gardens painting series is being shown for the first time at the Frieze London Art Fair, which will run from the 11th to the 15th of October.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: From small beginnings, Frieze has become an international fair, with sister shows in Los Angeles, New York and Seoul.
